Oklahoma State (2002-2004) NBA Draft: 2004 / Round: 1 / Pick: 25th Selected by the Boston Celtics Playing career: 2004-2018 (14 years) Career history 2004-2010 Boston Celtics 2010-2017 Memphis Grizzlies 2017-2018 New Orleans Pelicans Career highlights and awards

Big 12 Newcomer of the Year (2003)

Anthony Allen (born January 11, 1982), nicknamed "The Grindfather", is an American former professional basketball player who played for 15 seasons in the National Basketball Association (NBA). He is a six-time member on the NBA All-Defensive Team, including three times on the All-Defensive First Team. Allen attended Oklahoma University, he was drafted 25th overall by the Boston Celtics in the 2004 NBA Draft. Allen won an NBA championship with the Celtics in 2008. He is not related to Ray Allen who was also his championship teammate.
